title: Happy ending as Mason Mount and Declan Rice are set to start together
text:
Starting Mason Mount with Declan Rice in England's midfield is Roy of the Rovers-esque.

What a perfect ending it would be if they went on to win something together, too.

Mount and Rice, both 20 and expected to start against the Czech Republic, are old pals after first meeting at Chelsea's academy over a decade ago.

Mason Mount and Declan Rice, both 20, are expected to start against the Czech Republic

The pair are thick as thieves after meeting at Chelsea's academy over a decade ago

They are thick as thieves, though that friendship will be forgotten if Mount fails to track a runner! He'll get an earful from the defensive midfielder if that happens.

These are two young exciting players, each a work in progress.

They aren't the finished articles but will also be fully aware that Gareth Southgate's midfield is not set in stone either.

On Friday they have the chance to persuade the England manager to start them together more often. With Rice a regular, the onus is more on Mount to show us what he can offer.

On Friday they have the chance to persuade the England manager to start them together more

If Southgate opts for 4-3-3, he is likely to be on the left of Rice with Jordan Henderson on the right. If 4-2-3-1, Mount could be a No 10.

We have grown used to seeing the versatile playmaker in that role for Chelsea, though the left side of midfield is not alien to him. He has been used there under Frank Lampard this season too.

I don't see him struggling in either role for England. With his quick feet and smart decision-making, he can give Southgate food for thought.
